normalised: five G Rollout Gains Momentum Across India

unnormalised: New Delhi – The nationwide rollout of 5G services is progressing steadily, according to the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI). Major telecom operators, including Bharti Airtel and Reliance Jio, are expanding their 5G networks across Tier 1 and Tier 2 cities.
normalised: New Delhi – The nationwide rollout of five G services is progressing steadily, according to the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (T R A I). Major telecom operators, including Bharti Airtel and Reliance Jio, are expanding their five G networks across Tier one and Tier two cities.

unnormalised: Initial data suggests a significant increase in average download speeds for consumers in areas with 5G coverage, reaching up to 10x faster than existing 4G networks. The government aims to cover 80% of the country with 5G by December 2024, with ambitious plans for rural connectivity.
normalised: Initial data suggests a significant increase in average download speeds for consumers in areas with five G coverage, reaching up to ten times faster than existing four G networks. The government aims to cover eighty percent of the country with five G by December two thousand and twenty four, with ambitious plans for rural connectivity.

unnormalised: Telecom Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw stated on 26/01/2024 that the indigenous development of 6G technology is already underway at IIT Madras. He anticipates field trials commencing by 15/08/2025.
normalised: Telecom Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw stated on twenty sixth January two thousand and twenty four that the indigenous development of six G technology is already underway at I I T Madras. He anticipates field trials commencing by fifteenth August two thousand and twenty five.

unnormalised: Jio announced further investments of Rs. 20,000 crore towards expanding its 5G network in the North-East region by Q3 2024. Airtel has pledged to cover all district headquarters by 31/12/2024. Concerns remain about affordability and digital literacy, especially in rural areas, with workshops planned from 10:00 hrs on 01/04/2024 in villages to promote digital literacy. The total optical fiber laid out across the country now exceeds 1.5 million km.
normalised: Jio announced further investments of rupee twenty thousand crore towards expanding its five G network in the North-East region by Q three two thousand and twenty four. Airtel has pledged to cover all district headquarters by thirty first December two thousand and twenty four. Concerns remain about affordability and digital literacy, especially in rural areas, with workshops planned from ten zero zero hours on first April two thousand and twenty four in villages to promote digital literacy. The total optical fiber laid out across the country now exceeds one point five million kilometer.
